items.title: Wasserstein Contraction for Proportional Resampling (Conjecture)
items.content:
954: :label: lem-wasserstein-revival
955: 
956: If $\mathcal{R}$ is viewed as resampling from $\tilde{\rho} = \rho / \|\rho\|_{L^1}$, then:
957: 
958: $$
959: W_2(\mathcal{R}(\rho), \mathcal{R}(\sigma)) \le \lambda (1-m) W_2(\tilde{\rho}, \tilde{\sigma})
960: 
961: $$
962: 
963: for some average dead mass $m \approx (m_\rho + m_\sigma)/2$.

items.label: lem-drift-condition-corrected
items.title: Drift Condition with Quadratic Lyapunov
items.content:
2566: :label: lem-drift-condition-corrected
2567: 
2568: Under Assumptions A1 (confinement) and A3 (friction), there exist constants $a, b, c > 0$ such that the quadratic Lyapunov function:
2569: 
2570: $$
2571: V(x,v) = a|x|^2 + 2b x \cdot v + c|v|^2
2572: 
2573: $$
2574: 
2575: satisfies a drift condition with respect to the **adjoint operator** $\mathcal{L}^*$:
2576: 
2577: $$
2578: \mathcal{L}^*[V] \le -\beta V + C
2579: 
2580: $$
items.raw_directive:
2563: Moreover, the simple Lyapunov $V = |x|^2 + |v|^2$ does NOT satisfy a drift condition due to the cross-term $x \cdot v$. We need a **quadratic form** that handles this coupling.
2564: 
2565: :::{prf:lemma} Drift Condition with Quadratic Lyapunov
2566: :label: lem-drift-condition-corrected
2567: 
2568: Under Assumptions A1 (confinement) and A3 (friction), there exist constants $a, b, c > 0$ such that the quadratic Lyapunov function:
2569: 
2570: $$
2571: V(x,v) = a|x|^2 + 2b x \cdot v + c|v|^2
2572: 
2573: $$
2574: 
2575: satisfies a drift condition with respect to the **adjoint operator** $\mathcal{L}^*$:
2576: 
2577: $$
2578: \mathcal{L}^*[V] \le -\beta V + C
2579:

items.label: lem-fisher-bound
items.title: Fisher Information Bound
items.content:
4159: :label: lem-fisher-bound
4160: 
4161: There exists a constant $c_F > 0$ such that:
4162: 
4163: $$
4164: I_v(\rho) \ge c_F I_v(\rho \| \rho_\infty) - C_{\text{rem}}
4165: 
4166: $$
4167: 
4168: where $c_F = 1/2$ and $C_{\text{rem}} = 4C_{\nabla v}^2$.
4169: 
4170: Consequently:
4171: 
4172: $$
4173: \boxed{I_v(\rho) \ge 2\lambda_{\text{LSI}} D_{\text{KL}}(\rho \| \rho_\infty) - C_{\text{LSI}}}
4174: 
4175: $$
